entry.title: SPA, Isomorphic and Back to the Server: Our Journey With JS
entry.content:
This morning I gave a talk at the JsDay in Verona, describing how we went “back to the basics” with our latest revamp of our mobile website.

My presentation was mostly focused on performance and seeing how easy it is to combine fast servers (“10ms or less”) with frontend optimizations for extremely speedy web applications.

Here are the slides of the talk:

Unfortunately I had some videos and I’m known for giving talks that require people to be there as the slides are half of it (tip: that’s why you should come to these events!), but I think you can get the picture.

Cheers!

entry.title: A Tech Team of ~10 People
entry.content:
I am currently in Berlin, attending the 2016 Rocket Tech Summit: what a good opportunity to share some insights on how we run our business with such a small tech team.

Given recent news, I was extremely pleased to share some of our ideas / pillars with the Rocket-verse (and you as well):

To an even more fruitful 2017!

entry.title: Dockerize It: Stop Living in the Past and Embrace the Future
entry.content:
The guys from the codemotion recently released a bunch of videos from the last event they held in Rome — among those there’s one of my talks about adopting docker for fun and profit :)

Hope you won’t get bored!

entry.title: AngularJS, (Almost) a Year Later, at a PHP Conference
entry.content:
The first day of the SymfonyCon Madrid is almost over and, since I’m done with my talk, I’m gonna take the time to – as usual – put the slides here.

My talk went (I hope) well, and I am grateful to the guys that stopped me afterwards to clarify some of their doubts or to have a casual chat about Angular and other frontend-ish things.

Here are the slides:

By the way: 110% respect to SensioLabs for finding a venue which:

  • has great WiFi
  • serves yummy food
  • is 20 minutes away from a shisha place

Tomorrow it will be the second and last day of conference; afterwards I’m gonna catch an overnight flight to come back to my beloved Dubai: if you are at the conference, do not hesitate and ping me since…we’re still hiring!

entry.title: History of HTTP, SPDY and HTTP/2.0 - Video
entry.content:
…and the folks from the CakeFest ended up uploading my 2nd talk at the conference as well.

It was surely more difficult than my first talk (I was half sick that day) but I hope you will be able to enjoy this as well:

Cheers!
